chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant KEVIN JAMES JAY HANSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. KEVIN JAMES JAY HANSON is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • KEVIN JAMES JAY HANSON was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • KEVIN JAMES JAY HANSON was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 1:51 p.m. Defendant KEVIN JAMES JAY HANSON in court.  Attorney Nicole A Morley in court for KEVIN JAMES JAY HANSON.  Attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court discloses possible conflict.  Parties waive any conflicts.  Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Joint probation recommendation.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with. Defendant makes sentencing statement.
e-mail from WCSD--defendant released from custody
Letter from victim to Court regarding no contact provision
Washington County Jail - 08/29/22; emailed to Court Services/T.S.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  No contact with V1, W1 or W2 in NPD report 22-8273 and No violent contact with W3 in NPD report 22-8273.   Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.  Do not leave the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant KEVIN JAMES JAY HANSON in court VIA ZOOM with attorney Nicole A Morley.  Defendant KEVIN JAMES JAY HANSON in custody WINNEBAGO COUNTY JAIL.  Amanda Nash appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information on file; acknowledge receipt.  Reading waived - plea entered.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  Defense moves the court to modify bond to signature bond - victim addresses court - State requests D24/7 program & no violent contact if amended to signature bond.  Court amends to signature bond with the addition of D24/7 - all other conditions remain as ordered.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

The Court will not amend bond.  Bond Continues.  Record closed @ 9:37.  Arraignment scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
